intro: Lophostachys monticola, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, characterized by its drought-resistant adaptations. The plant features palmate leaves and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It has a deep root system that allows it to access water from deeper soil layers. Lophostachys monticola is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in desert ecosystems.
